  • Method Details

    • login

      @PostMapping(value="/login", produces="text/plain") public String login(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Allows client to log in to the system and creates a session for the current user.
      Parameters:
      request - - http request sent by client
      Returns:
      - a string response which includes session token id to use in other api endpoints.

    • logout

      @DeleteMapping(value="/logout", produces="text/plain") public String logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Allows client to log out from the system and deletes the session and session cookie.
      Parameters:
      request - - http request sent by client
      Returns:
      - string type of message

    • requestPasswordReset

      @PostMapping("/password-reset-request") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> requestPasswordReset(@RequestParam("email") String userEmail)
      Endpoint to request a password reset. Generates a random token using UUID's randomUUID() method and stores it in the database. Sends an email with a password reset link if the user with the provided email exists.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email address of the user requesting a password reset
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of the password reset request
      See Also:
      • PasswordResetService.createPasswordResetTokenForUser(User, String)
      • PasswordResetService.sendPasswordResetMail(String, String)

    • setNewPassword

      @GetMapping("/set-new-password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> setNewPassword(@RequestParam("token") String token, @RequestParam("password") String newPassword)
      Endpoint to set a new password for the user. Validates the provided token before resetting the password. Token is deleted from the database after the password is reset. New password is hashed and stored in the database.
      Parameters:
      token - The password reset token sent to the user's email address
      newPassword - The new password to be set for the user, provided by the user
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity indicating the result of the password update process
      See Also:
      • HashUtil.bcrypt(String, String)
      • PasswordResetService.getUserByValidatedPasswordResetToken(String)
      • PasswordResetService.deletePasswordResetToken(String)
